page.title: 10HEALTH IN GREENOCK
page.content: The general {health} of the people of this area is not very good. They should improve their diet and exercise more often. They should also cut down on smoking, drinking alcohol and stop using drugs and solvents. The most common{diseases}are dental decay and the common cold. The{infant mortality rate}in this area is 12.3 per 1000. This can be compared with the figure for Scotland as a whole which is 9.9 per 1000. Not all children are{immunised}at the right age. School children have medical checks at the ages of 5 and 14. The school nurse visits weekly to keep a regular check on the children. There are no doctors' surgeries in this area, so people have to go the { {health centre} which is in the centre of the town.
